Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Interpenetrated MOF containing two unique channels

Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.54 mol % of [Rh] in benzene at 35 °C for 24 h
Other Information.Additional Info: Kinetic diameter of 2a (9.5 Å) is larger than the MOF's pore window (9 Å), preventing hydrogenation.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.54 mol % of [Rh] in benzene at 35 °C for 24 h
Other Information.Additional Info: Kinetic diameter of 2b (16 Å) is significantly larger than the MOF's pore window (9 Å), preventing hydrogenation.

Sieving Mechanism: Size-selective catalysis based on rigid pore apertures

Other Information.Additional Info: Anionic at the metal node. Modest thermal stability (~120 °C). Used as a support for cationic Rh complexes via ion exchange.

Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Large pseudospherical pores with hexagonal pore windows

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, smaller molecule passes readily

Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.54 mol % of [Rh] in benzene at 35 °C for 24 h
Other Information.Additional Info: Kinetic diameter (9.5 Å) is smaller than the pore window (16 x 14 Å), allowing full conversion.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, passage restricted by proximity to pore window size

Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.54 mol % of [Rh] in benzene at 35 °C for 24 h
Other Information.Additional Info: Kinetic diameter (16 Å) is close to the pore window (16 x 14 Å), leading to partial hydrogenation.

Sieving Mechanism: Size-selective catalysis based on pore aperture

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Full conversion for 2a (TON = 185); Partial hydrogenation for 2b (TON = 52).

Other Information.Additional Info: Anionic charge centered on the organic linker. High thermal stability (~275 °C). Used as a support for cationic Rh complexes via ion exchange.
